summary: RCM Church Website (Parishudda Japamaala Maatha Devalayamu / Holy Rosary Catholic Church) — A Next.js single-page church website with an admin dashboard using Local JSON as a database. Admin panel at /admin with hardcoded password. Landing page displays data managed by admin. Located in Nellore with Google Maps integration.
architectural_notes: Next.js App Router with SSG/ISR; local /data/*.json files as database; API routes use Node.js fs to write JSON
Admin auth via middleware.ts checking auth_session cookie; hardcoded password: ChurchofHolyRosary@2026
Media uploads stored in /public/uploads/; paths saved in media.json
Local JSON approach only works on VPS (not Vercel serverless); note this limitation in code comments
Admin form drafts persisted in localStorage/sessionStorage to survive tab switches; cleared only on logout
Sacred UI: Playfair Display font, gold border (#D4AF37), gradient overlays, Framer Motion whileInView slide-up animations, pulse on Donation button

existing_features.title: Build a professional single-page landing site for 'Parishudda Japamaala Maatha Devalayamu (Holy Rosary Catholic Church)' in Nellore. The page must be composed of the following sections in order: Navbar, Hero, Announcements Banner, Daily Mass Schedule, Daily Spiritual Message, Prayer Module, Church Media Gallery, Online Donation CTA, Google Map, and Footer.

Apply a sacred, professional holy visual theme across the entire site. Use deep navy/midnight blue and warm ivory/cream as primary colors. Accent with gold (#D4AF37) for borders, headings, and highlights. Use Playfair Display (serif) for headings and a clean sans-serif for body text. Add a linear-gradient(to bottom, rgba(0,0,0,0.7), transparent) overlay on the Hero image. Use gold borders (#D4AF37) on Priest Welcome and Feast Day cards. All sections should slide up as they enter the viewport. The Online Donation button must have a subtle CSS pulse animation.

Implement a scroll-aware Navbar. On load, the Navbar background is transparent. When the user scrolls past 50px, it transitions to a solid deep navy/blue-900 background. Include the church name and navigation links to each page section.

Create a Daily Mass Schedule section that reads from a local data store (Motoko backend stable variable acting as a JSON-like record). Display a table/card list of mass timings with fields: Day, Time, and Service Type (Mass / Confession / Adoration). Seed with default data: Sunday 6:30 AM Telugu Mass and Sunday 8:30 AM English Mass.

Create a Daily Spiritual Message section that reads from backend state. Display a card with fields: Title, Author (Pope/Priest name), Full Text, and Date. Implement a 'Read More' modal that expands the full message text with an animation when clicked.

Create a Prayer Module section with a language filter toggle/search input allowing users to switch between Telugu and English prayers. Prayers are stored in backend state and displayed as cards or a list. The filter updates the visible prayers in real time using React state.

Create a Church Media Gallery section that reads from backend state. Display uploaded images and YouTube video embeds with captions in a responsive grid. Images are stored as base64 or URL references; YouTube URLs render as embedded iframes.

Create an Announcements Banner at the top of the page (below Navbar) that reads from backend state. Display highlight text, event date, and respect an 'Active' toggle — only show the banner when Active is true.

Embed the Google Map for the church location using the shared URL https://share.google/RgB7sMob1CDcBHUIp. Since shared Google links cannot be iframed directly, display a prominent 'View on Google Maps' button/link that opens the URL in a new tab, accompanied by the church address in Nellore.

Build a protected Admin Dashboard at the /admin route. Guard it with a login page that checks a hardcoded password: ChurchofHolyRosary@2026. On successful login, set an auth_session value in localStorage. On subsequent visits, if the auth session is valid, skip the login screen. Provide a logout button that clears the session.

Build the Admin Dashboard with four management modules: (1) Mass Schedule — add/edit/delete entries with Day, Time, Service Type fields; (2) Spiritual Message — form with Title, Author, Full Text, Date fields; (3) Media Gallery — upload images (single file and bulk folder selection), add YouTube URLs, add captions, and manage/delete existing items; (4) Announcements — form with Highlight Text, Event Date, and Active toggle. Each module has a Save button that persists data to Motoko backend state via canister calls.

Persist unsaved admin form draft state using localStorage so that if the admin switches browser tabs or navigates away without saving, the in-progress form data is still present when they return to the admin panel. Draft state must only be cleared when the admin explicitly logs out or clicks Save successfully.

new_feature_requests.summary: Full landing page with sacred/holy professional UI including Hero, Navbar (scroll-aware), DailyMessage, DailyUpdates (Mass Schedule), ChurchMedia, Prayer Module (Telugu/English filter), Announcements banner, Online Donation button with pulse animation, Google Map embed, Framer Motion scroll animations
Admin dashboard at /admin with modules: Mass Schedule, Spiritual Message, Media Gallery, Announcements — all saving to local JSON files via Next.js API routes using fs module
Admin Media Gallery enhancement: support direct folder upload of images and videos (bulk folder selection) in addition to single file uploads and YouTube URLs
Admin auth via middleware.ts checking auth_session cookie; hardcoded password: ChurchofHolyRosary@2026
Prevent admin form data from vanishing on tab switch — use localStorage or sessionStorage to persist unsaved draft state; only clear on explicit logout
Admin saves must persist to the landing page — ensure API writes to JSON and landing page re-fetches/revalidates to reflect updated content

Implement all backend data storage using Motoko stable variables in the single main actor. Store: massTimings (array of records with day, time, serviceType), spiritualMessage (record with title, author, fullText, date), mediaItems (array of records with type, url/base64, caption), and announcement (record with text, eventDate, active). Expose update and query functions for each data type.
